intro: Achyranthes lindenii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
